title: Convert all currency displays from USD ($) to Indian Rupees (₹)

requirements.summary: Convert all currency displays throughout the application from US Dollars ($) to Indian Rupees (₹) by updating the formatCurrency utility function and ensuring the change propagates to all pages and components that display monetary values
acceptanceCriteria: The formatCurrency utility uses locale 'en-IN' and currency 'INR', displaying ₹ symbol.
Dashboard total revenue and monthly revenue figures display with ₹ symbol.
Invoice line item prices, subtotals, and totals display with ₹ symbol.
Expense amounts and category-grouped totals display with ₹ symbol.
Product/Inventory unit prices display with ₹ symbol.
Reports page revenue bars, expense vs revenue comparison, and top products revenue display with ₹ symbol.
No $ symbol appears anywhere in the application UI.

file_operations.description: Update the formatCurrency function to use locale 'en-IN' and currency code 'INR' instead of 'en-US' and 'USD', ensuring the ₹ symbol is displayed for all monetary values. This change will automatically propagate to all components and pages that call this utility function.

Verify that all currency displays in Dashboard metric cards (total revenue, monthly revenue summary) and the recent invoices list correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.

Verify that all currency displays in the invoices table (total amounts) correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.

Verify that all currency displays in the invoice detail modal (line item prices, subtotals, total amount) correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.

Verify that all currency displays in the invoice form (line item prices, calculated total) correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.

Verify that all currency displays in the expenses table and category summary section correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.

Verify that any currency displays in the expense form correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.

Verify that all currency displays in the product/inventory table (unit prices) correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.

Verify that any currency displays in the product form correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.

Verify that all currency displays in the reports page (monthly revenue bar chart tooltips/labels, expense vs revenue comparison, top products revenue) correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.

Verify that all currency displays in the customer detail modal (invoice totals, total revenue summary) correctly use the updated formatCurrency utility and display the ₹ symbol. No code changes should be needed if the utility is correctly imported and used.
